lead_paragraph: Some economists warn that the policies largely favored by the banks could further alienate the public and increase the frustration that encouraged Britons to vote for leaving the European Union.

headline.print_headline: Central Banks Wary of Engaging World Markets After ‘Brexit’
headline.main: Central Banks Worry About Engaging World Markets After ‘Brexit’

snippet: Some economists warn that the policies largely favored by the banks could further alienate the public and increase the frustration that encouraged Britons to vote for leaving the European Union.
abstract: British vote to exit European Union increases sense of urgency at meeting of global central bankers in Basel, Switzerland; many leading central bankers worry that central bank activism in response to market shocks following 'Brexit' vote could do more harm than good; worry that action could reaffirm anger and frustration at global elites that was in part responsible for result of vote.
